intro: Sisymbrium erysimoides, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has slender, branching stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are arranged in loose clusters and are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. Sisymbrium erysimoides is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields.
